name: Yellow Scarves Cavalry
text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Yellow Scarves Cavalry can't block.

name: Yellow Scarves General
text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Yellow Scarves General can't block.

editions.flavor: Zhang Jue, leader of the Yellow Scarves rebellion, was a Taoist master and tutored his soldiers in those arts.

name: Yellow Scarves Troops
text: Yellow Scarves Troops can't block.

editions.flavor: Over 500,000 commoners followed Zhang Jue, General of Heaven, in his attempt to overthrow the corrupt Han dynasty.

name: Yet Another Aether Vortex
text:
All creatures have haste.
Players play with the top card of their libraries revealed.
Noninstant, nonsorcery cards on top of a library are in play under their owner's control in addition to being in that library.

editions.flavor: It puts the "vortex" in "flavortext."

name: Yet Another Æther Vortex
text:
All creatures have haste.
Players play with the top card of their libraries revealed.
Noninstant, nonsorcery cards on top of a library are in play under their owner's control in addition to being in that library.

editions.flavor: It puts the "vortex" in "flavortext."

name: Yeva, Nature's Herald
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
You may cast green creature spells as though they had flash.

editions.flavor: "I can call an army to my side in the blink of an eye. Best not blink."

name: Yeva's Forcemage
text: When Yeva's Forcemage enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Nature can't be stopped. It rips and tears at Ravnica's tallest buildings to claim its place in the sun."
"Nature can't be stopped. It rips and tears at Ravnica's tallest buildings to claim its place in the sun."

name: Yew Spirit
text: {2}{G}{G}: Yew Spirit gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is its power.

editions.flavor:
"I wonder what dwelled in the primordial forests before humans existed."
—Elder Rimheit

name: Yidris, Maelstrom Wielder
text:
Trample
Whenever Yidris, Maelstrom Wielder deals combat damage to a player, as you cast spells from your hand this turn, they gain cascade. (When you cast the spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom of your library in a random order.)

name: Yisan, the Wanderer Bard
text: {2}{G}, {T}, Put a verse counter on Yisan, the Wanderer Bard: Search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost equal to the number of verse counters on Yisan, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Designed by Brian Fargo

name: Yixlid Jailer
text: Cards in graveyards lose all abilities.

editions.flavor: He holds the keys to a tombful of incarcerated secrets.
"I have an eternity to know the souls who are bound here, to behold their every facet. But moments from now they will be gagged and masked, and they shall be known by none other."

It was in fields of grain, not fields of battle, that the Champion learned to bear the yoke of duty to the gods. She worked the land long before she was called on to defend it.
—The Theriad
It was in fields of grain, not fields of battle, that the Champion learned to bear the yoke of duty to the gods. She worked the land long before she was called on to defend it.—The Theriad

name: Yoked Plowbeast
text: Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor:
"It is sacrilege to confine a gargantuan to the grinding of straight lines. I will pray that it remembers who is the master of this land."
—Syeena, elvish godtoucher

name: Yoke of the Damned
text:
Enchant creature
When a creature dies, destroy enchanted creature.

editions.flavor: The demon's yoke is part leash, part noose.
The demon's yoke is part leash, part noose.

name: Yomiji, Who Bars the Way
text: Whenever a legendary permanent other than Yomiji, Who Bars the Way is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"As I died, I rejoiced. I would see my family again. But then I woke up back on the battlefield. Back in Kamigawa. Back in hell."
—Kenzo the Hardhearted

name: Yore-Tiller Nephilim
text: Whenever Yore-Tiller Nephilim attacks, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped and attacking.

editions.flavor: When it awoke, the worms of the earth hissed in a chorus of beckoning.

name: Yosei, the Morning Star
text:
Flying
When Yosei, the Morning Star dies, target player skips his or her next untap step. Tap up to five target permanents that player controls.

name: Yotian Soldier
text: Vigilance

editions.flavor: After Kroog was destroyed while most of its defenders were at his side, Urza vowed that none of his allies would ever need to fear for their own defense again, even while laying siege to a city far from their homes.

Poets dream the verses of otherworldly stories. Artificers dream the blueprints of otherplanar artifacts.

name: Young Pyromancer
text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, create a 1/1 red Elemental creature token.

editions.flavor: Immolation is the sincerest form of flattery.
Immolation is the sincerest form of flattery.

name: Young Wei Recruits
text: Young Wei Recruits can't block.

editions.flavor:
"To send the common people to war untrained is to throw them away."
—Confucius, The Analects (trans. Lau)

"To send the common people to war untrained is to throw them away."
—Confucius, The Analects (trans. Lau)

name: Young Wolf
text: Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: The Ulvenwald makes no allowances for youth. Today's newborn is either tomorrow's hunter or tomorrow's lunch.

name: Your Fate Is Thrice Sealed
text: When you set this scheme in motion, reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all land cards revealed this way onto the battlefield and the rest into your hand.

editions.flavor: "I can't abide laziness. Arise, forces of nature, and serve your master!"

name: Your Puny Minds Cannot Fathom
text: When you set this scheme in motion, draw four cards. You have no maximum hand size until your next turn.

editions.flavor: "I have seen far beyond this imperfect world, into a tomorrow that doesn't include you."

name: Your Will Is Not Your Own
text: When you set this scheme in motion, gain control of target creature an opponent controls until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gets +3/+3 and gains trample and haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Fool. I'll show you how to use that thing."

name: Youthful Knight
text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

editions.flavor:
"Let no child be without a sword. We will all fight, for if we fail, we will certainly all die."
—Oracle en-Vec

"Let no child be without a sword. We will all fight, for if we fail, we will certainly all die."
—Oracle en-Vec

"Let no child be without a sword. We will all fight, for if we fail, we will certainly all die."
—Oracle en-Vec
Idealism fits him better than his armor.

name: Youthful Scholar
text: When Youthful Scholar dies, draw two cards.

editions.flavor:
"Too dumb, and you end up a sibsig. Too smart, and you end up a meal. Mediocrity is the key to a long life."
—Mogai, Silumgar noble

name: Yuan Shao's Infantry
text: Whenever Yuan Shao's Infantry attacks alone, Yuan Shao's Infantry can't be blocked this combat.

name: Yuan Shao, the Indecisive
text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature.

name: Yuki-Onna
text:
When Yuki-Onna enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may return Yuki-Onna to its owner's hand.

name: Yukora, the Prisoner
text: When Yukora, the Prisoner leaves the battlefield, sacrifice all non-Ogre creatures you control.

editions.flavor: It took ninety-nine monks to weave the spell that trapped Yukora. Upon the death of the ninety-nine, the spell was broken, and the demon returned to the mortal world seeking vengeance for its imprisonment.

name: Yule Ooze
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy another nonland permanent chosen at random, then put a number of +1/+1 counters on Yule Ooze equal to that permanent's converted mana cost.
{R}{G}, Eat some food: Regenerate Yule Ooze.

editions.flavor: It loves having family for dinner.

name: Zada, Hedron Grinder
text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell that targets only Zada, Hedron Grinder, copy that spell for each other creature you control that the spell could target. Each copy targets a different one of those creatures.

editions.flavor: "A hedron holds magic for a thousand years—or less, if need be."
"A hedron holds magic for a thousand years—or less, if need be."

name: Zada's Commando
text:
First strike
Cohort — {T}, Tap an untapped Ally you control: Zada's Commando deals 1 damage to target opponent.

editions.flavor:
"There's a word for someone who brings too much gear to battle: ‘survivor.'"
—Zada of Slab Haven

name: Zameck Guildmage
text:
{G}{U}: This turn, each creature you control enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
{G}{U}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from a creature you control: Draw a card.

name: Zanam Djinn
text:
Flying
Zanam Djinn gets -2/-2 as long as blue is the most common color among all permanents or is tied for most common.

name: Zanikev Locust
text:
Flying
Scavenge {2}{B}{B} ({2}{B}{B}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)

name: Zap
text:
Zap deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: "All this time I thought Squee was useless," chuckled Sisay. "Who knew he'd be such a good shot?"

name: Zarichi Tiger
text: {1}{W}, {T}: You gain 2 life.

editions.flavor:
"The taming and consecration of these creatures is evidence of our faith."
—Resimir, Zarichi Temple priest

name: Zealot il-Vec
text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever Zealot il-Vec attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it deal 1 damage to target creature. If you do, prevent all combat damage Zealot il-Vec would deal this turn.

name: Zealots en-Dal
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if all nonland permanents you control are white, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"Great chains shall free our warriors."
—Oracle en-Vec

name: Zealous Conscripts
text:
Haste
When Zealous Conscripts enters the battlefield, gain control of target permanent until end of turn. Untap that permanent. It gains haste until end of turn.

name: Zealous Guardian
text: Flash

editions.flavor: Parapet watchers patrol the outer edges of the doun, signaling to others who wait patiently in shadow.

name: Zealous Inquisitor
text: {1}{W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Zealous Inquisitor this turn is dealt to target creature instead.

editions.flavor: Wine and balm for the confessions of the repentant. Razors and irons for the confessions of the unrepentant.
"I only return what rightly belongs to another."

name: Zealous Persecution
text: Until end of turn, creatures you control get +1/+1 and creatures your opponents control get -1/-1.

editions.flavor:
"Jharic returned from Grixis changed, a haunted look in her eyes. She destroyed them with an unholy glee that made me shudder."

name: Zealous Strike
text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Cower, fiend. The night is yours no longer."
"Cower, fiend. The night is yours no longer."

name: Zebra Unicorn
text: Whenever Zebra Unicorn deals damage, you gain that much life.

editions.flavor:
"I'll capture gentle zebras / for your steeds and fill the stable with every kind of unicorn."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Zedruu the Greathearted
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain X life and draw X cards, where X is the number of permanents you own that your opponents control.
{R}{W}{U}: Target opponent gains control of target permanent you control.

name: Zektar Shrine Expedition
text:
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may put a quest counter on Zektar Shrine Expedition.
Remove three quest counters from Zektar Shrine Expedition and sacrifice it: Create a 7/1 red Elemental creature token with trample and haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Zelyon Sword
text:
You may choose not to untap Zelyon Sword during your untap step.
{3}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+0 for as long as Zelyon Sword remains tapped.

editions.flavor: No sheath shall hold what finds its home in flesh.

name: Zendikar Farguide
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

editions.flavor: Expeditions follow the paths it leaves in its wake.

name: Zendikar Incarnate
text: Zendikar Incarnate's power is equal to the number of lands you control.

editions.flavor: "Her people angered Zendikar, and they faced the land's wrath. That is why Nissa is the last of the animists."—Numa, Joraga chieftain

name: Zendikar Resurgent
text:
Whenever you tap a land for mana, add one mana to your mana pool of any type that land produced. (The types of mana are white, blue, black, red, green, and colorless.)
Whenever you cast a creature spell, draw a card.

name: Zendikar's Roil
text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, create a 2/2 green Elemental creature token.

editions.flavor: "I was wrong. Zendikar isn't after me. It isn't after any of us. It's not evil or vengeful. It's magnificent . . . but it's in pain."—Nissa Revane

name: Zephid
text:
Flying
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor: Once you've seen one, you'll understand why spells won't go near them.

name: Zephid's Embrace
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying and shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor: Spells will shun you, as will everyone else.

name: Zephyr Charge
text: {1}{U}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"All armies prefer high ground to low and sunny places to dark."
—Sun Tzu, Art of War, trans. Giles

name: Zephyr Falcon
text: Flying, vigilance

editions.flavor: Although greatly prized among falconers, the Zephyr Falcon is capricious and not easily tamed.

name: Zephyr Net
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has defender and flying.

editions.flavor: Faeries hang beings that interest them as ornaments in the sky, each clique competing to outshine the prize of the last.

name: Zephyr Scribe
text:
{U}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, untap Zephyr Scribe.

editions.flavor:
"Ojutai's rule has allowed Tarkir's monks to learn from the truly enlightened."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Zephyr Spirit
text: When Zephyr Spirit blocks, return it to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: A spiteful force exists on Ravnica that binds these ghosts to the land of the living but forbids them to touch it.

name: Zephyr Sprite
text: Flying

editions.flavor: "I've never understood why so many beings lumber around on the ground. There are three dimensions, yet they use only two."

name: Zerapa Minotaur
text:
First strike
{2}: Zerapa Minotaur loses first strike until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.

editions.flavor: There's no difference between bone and crystal when it's piercing your throat.

text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)

—Sidar Jabari

"War is the crucible of leadership."

—Rashida Scalebane

name: Zhalfirin Knight
text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{W}{W}: Zhalfirin Knight gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"You returned a warrior. . . . Your hair was cut, your eye tattooed with the red triangle of war."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Zhang Fei, Fierce Warrior
text: Vigilance; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

editions.flavor: Zhang Fei's uncharacteristic alliance with a defeated Riverlands general, Yan Yan, allowed Shu forces to advance through forty-five Riverlands strongpoints with no casualties.

name: Zhang He, Wei General
text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Whenever Zhang He, Wei General attacks, each other creature you control gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

name: Zhang Liao, Hero of Hefei
text: Whenever Zhang Liao, Hero of Hefei deals damage to an opponent, that opponent discards a card.

name: Zhao Zilong, Tiger General
text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Whenever Zhao Zilong, Tiger General blocks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Zhao Zilong was a brave and noble warrior. Twice he rescued Liu Bei's son, Liu Shan.

name: Zhou Yu, Chief Commander
text: Zhou Yu, Chief Commander can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

editions.flavor:
"After making me, Zhou Yu, did you have to make Kongming?"
—Zhou Yu crying to heaven on his deathbed

name: Zhuge Jin, Wu Strategist
text: {T}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

editions.flavor: When Zhuge Jin proposed the marriage of Guan Yu's daugher and Sun Quan's heir, Guan Yu's arrogant refusal led to disaster.

name: Zhur-Taa Ancient
text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.

editions.flavor: Many Ravnicans think of nature as orderly groves and elf-tended rot farms. They haven't seen the Gruul wilds.

name: Zhur-Taa Druid
text:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
Whenever you tap Zhur-Taa Druid for mana, it deals 1 damage to each opponent.

editions.flavor: "Only the decadent think magic should be pristine and without cost."
"Only the decadent think magic should be pristine and without cost."
"Only the decadent think magic should be pristine and without cost."

name: Zhur-Taa Swine
text: Bloodrush — {1}{R}{G}, Discard Zhur-Taa Swine: Target attacking creature gets +5/+4 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Gurley was the first to domesticate one, though his widow didn't take much solace in that accomplishment.

name: Zirilan of the Claw
text: {1}{R}{R}, {T}: Search your library for a Dragon permanent card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library. That Dragon gains haste until end of turn. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Zodiac Dog
text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

editions.flavor: ". . . Jiang Wei alone still strove with might and main: / Nine times more he fought the north—in vain. . . ."

name: Zodiac Dragon
text: When Zodiac Dragon is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may return it to your hand.

editions.flavor: ". . . The kingdoms three are now the stuff of dream,/ For men to ponder, past all praise or blame."
". . . The kingdoms three are now the stuff of dream, / For men to ponder, past all praise or blame."

name: Zodiac Goat
text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

editions.flavor: ". . . Near death in Baidi, having reigned three years, / Bei sadly placed his son in Kongming's care. . . ."

name: Zodiac Horse
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

editions.flavor: ". . . ‘First take Jingzhou, next the Riverlands; / On that rich region, base your own royal stand.' . . ."

name: Zodiac Monkey
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

editions.flavor: It lives mainly on fruit, leaves, and the occasional nose.

". . . By six offensives from the hills of Qi
Kongming sought to change Han's destiny. . . ."

name: Zodiac Ox
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

editions.flavor: ". . . Cao's abdication changed the face of all; / No mighty battles marked the Southland's fall. . . ."

name: Zodiac Pig
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

editions.flavor: ". . . Zhong Hui and Deng Ai next led armies west: / And to the Cao, Han's hills and streams now passed. . . ."

name: Zodiac Rabbit
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

editions.flavor: ". . . The world's affairs rush on, an endless stream; / A sky-told fate, infinite in reach, dooms all. . . ."

name: Zodiac Rat
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

editions.flavor: " . . . Cao Pi, Cao Rui, Fang, Mao, and briefly, Huan— / The Sima took the empire in their turn. . . ."

name: Zodiac Rooster
text: Plainswalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Plains.)

editions.flavor: ". . . But the time of Han had run—could he Kongming not tell?— / That night his master star fell past the hills. . . ."

name: Zodiac Snake
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

editions.flavor: "Thrice Xuande's ardent quest led to Nanyang, / Where Sleeping Dragon unveiled Han's partition: . . ."

name: Zodiac Tiger
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

editions.flavor: ". . . Three kings no more—Chenliu, Guiming, Anle. / The fiefs and posts must now be filled anew. . . ."

text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Shades are drawn to places of power, often rooting themselves in a single area to feed.
It haunts the remnants of the Helix of Zof, leeching strength from the vast Eldrazi ruin.

name: Zombie Apocalypse
text: Return all Zombie creature cards from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped, then destroy all Humans.

editions.flavor:
"There will come a day so dark you will pray for death. On that day your prayers will be answered."
—Minaldra, the Vizag Atum

name: Zombie Assassin
text: {T}, Exile two cards from your graveyard and Zombie Assassin: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor:
"Zombies don't kill. They recruit."
—Braids, dementia summoner

name: Zombie Boa
text: {1}{B}: Choose a color. Whenever Zombie Boa becomes blocked by a creature of that color this turn, destroy that creature. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: It doesn't need to feed, but still it hungers.

name: Zombie Brute
text:
Amplify 1 (As this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it for each Zombie card you reveal in your hand.)
Trample

editions.flavor: Measure its determination by the screams of its prey.

name: Zombie Cannibal
text: Whenever Zombie Cannibal deals combat damage to a player, you may exile target card from that player's graveyard.

editions.flavor: Nothing is sacred to the undead—not even their own kind.

name: Zombie Cutthroat
text: Morph—Pay 5 life. (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.flavor: The single-mindedness of a zombie, the cunning of an assassin.

name: Zombie Fanboy
text:
As Zombie Fanboy comes into play, choose an artist.
Whenever a permanent by the chosen artist is put into a graveyard, put two +1/+1 counters on Zombie Fanboy.

editions.flavor: The real advantage of being a zombie gamer? No one notices the stench.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis

"Removing the encumbrance of useless brain tissue grants several advantages: a slight increase in mobility, a response of revulsion and horror from the enemy, and, in the case of large specimens, room for passengers."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

"Removing the encumbrance of useless brain tissue grants several advantages: a slight increase in mobility, a response of revulsion and horror from the enemy, and, in the case of large specimens, room for passengers."

—Keren-Dur, necromancer lord
